articles.author: Jack Queen, Luc Cohen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: The former president will hear prosecutors explain why his alleged cover-up of a hush money payment to a porn star during his 2016 campaign broke the law.
articles.title: Trump hush-money trial kicks off with opening statements in New York

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Charlotte Bruneau
articles.description: For the exhausted Ukrainian artillery gunners holding off Russian forces near the eastern town of Kupiansk, the U.S. aid package expected to finally pass this week is a lifeline and, potentially, a gamechanger, although that could take some time.
articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: What difference will US aid package make?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Israeli military intelligence, Major General Aharon Haliva, has resigned and will leave once a successor is appointed, the military said in a statement on Monday.
articles.title: Israeli military intelligence head resigns

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed 14 Palestinians during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Saturday, while an ambulance driver was killed as he went to pick up wounded from a separate attack by violent Jewish settlers, Palestinian authorities said.
articles.title: More than 14 Palestinians killed as violence flares in West Bank

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Monday that the support of the United States, Britain and France for Ukraine was stoking serious strategic risks that had raised the risk of a direct confrontation between the world's biggest nuclear powers.
articles.title: Russia says West is teetering on brink of conflict between nuclear powers

articles.author: Andrey Sychev, Rachel More
articles.description: Three German nationals have been arrested on suspicion of working with the Chinese secret service to hand over technology that could be used for military purposes, prosecutors said on Monday.
articles.title: Germany arrests three people suspected of giving technology to China

articles.author: Ananda Teresia, Stanley Widianto
articles.description: An Indonesian court on Monday rejected challenges from both losing candidates seeking a re-run of February's presidential election and the disqualification of winner Prabowo Subianto and his running mate, bringing an end to all election disputes.
articles.title: Indonesia court rejects election disputes, upholding president-elect Prabowo's win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said on Monday the first flight carrying asylum seekers to Rwanda would leave in 10-12 weeks, as he set out plans for for his flagship policy to tackle illegal migration.
articles.title: UK's Sunak says first migrant flight to Rwanda will leave in 10-12 weeks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Norway's 87-year-old King Harald will permanently scale back the number of official activities in which he takes part following his recent illness, the royal household said on Monday.
articles.title: Norway's King Harald, 87, to reduce activity after illness

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six soldiers of the Nigerian army were ambushed and killed by gunmen while on patrol in the northern Niger state on Friday, the army said, the latest loss inflicted on the military by armed criminal gangs.
articles.title: Gunmen kill six Nigerian soldiers in ambush, army says
